snippet: The investigator, Richard Falk, accused Israel on Monday of imposing collective punishment on 1.75 million Palestinians in the Gaza Strip and said that the enclave’s viability was at stake.
abstract: Richard Falk, United Nations human rights investigator for the Palestinian territories, says he will not resign despite accusations of antisemitism; accuses critics of trying to divert attention from his scrutiny of Israeli policies.
lead_paragraph: The investigator, Richard Falk, accused Israel on Monday of imposing collective punishment on 1.75 million Palestinians in the Gaza Strip and said that the enclave’s viability was at stake.

headline.main: Palestinian Rights Investigator Says He Will Not Resign, Despite Criticism
headline.print_headline: Palestinian Rights Investigator Says He Will Not Resign, Despite Criticism
